abstracts.cdata!:
The Vilnius District Heating Project
            aims at reducing the cost of, and at improving the quality
            of district heating supply, while supporting the commercial
            viability, and possible privatization pf the Vilnius
            District Heating Company (VDHC). Project components call
            for: 1) elimination of most of the remaining block
            substations, to be replaced by the installation of
            building-level individual substations, automated to reduce
            energy consumption, and to convert the system from a supply,
            to a demand-driven operation model; 2) rehabilitation of
            heat-only-boilers, by either replacement with new boilers,
            or new burners and pumps, and, installation of heat
            exchangers, and related equipment, depending on each case
            priority, to reduce fuel consumption, operating costs, and
            emissions; 3) combined heat and power plant rehabilitation,
            with a new process control, and instrumental system, to
            improve reliability, and efficiency. Environmentally
            friendly low-Nox burner units, should be adjusted for both
            mazut, and gas firing to reduce emissions, and an additional
            feed water pump unit should improve plant reliability.
            Hydraulic and lubrication systems for the turbo-generator
            will improve reliability, and control, while frequency
            controlled district heating pumps would adjust the plant
            demand-driven variable water flow operation mode, and, a
            regenerative air pre-heater would improve efficiency; and,
            4) technical assistance to improve management information
            systems, covering accounting procedures, financial
            management, and customer databases to enable prompt
            processing, and managerial information to enhance cost
            control, and monitoring. Project management will assist with
            procurement, supervision, and management.

repnme.cdata!:
Lithuania - Vilnius District Heating
            Project : environmental management plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This Environmental Management Plan (EMP)
            reviews the potential adversity on the environment,
            resulting from implementation of the Vilnius District
            Heating Project, and, addresses mitigating measures as
            follows. During construction, dust and noise pollution will
            occur, therefore water sprinklers will be available during
            the dry season to control air pollution; construction
            activities will be limited to daytime schedules in
            compliance with noise ordinance regulations; and, noise
            meters will be installed to control potential disturbances
            to schools, and local populations. Workers will be provided
            with noise abatement, protection devices. Solid wastes, such
            as metals will be recycled, as specified in the bidding
            documents; hazardous materials will be handled by licensed
            companies, in accordance with government regulations; while,
            existing PCBs content should be clarified, and transformers
            tested for PCBs. Concrete, and scrap materials will be
            removed to selected disposal sites, and, production of new
            pipe insulation, will be in accordance with Government
            regulations, as per the Montreal Protocol, and as specified
            in the bidding documents. To control emissions, low nitric
            oxide (NOx) burners, and oil with low sulfur content will be
            used. Water leakage will undergo extended maintenance
            measures, while fuel and oil spills, in addition to extended
            maintenance measures will be collected through special
            devices. Institutional arrangements shall supervise
            collection, storage, and data handling, for due analysis,
            and reporting, to be finally authorized by the Technical Director.
